author: Ngunan Ioron Aloho, esq, PMP
text:
True! 

The Viomeren project where we investigated lived experiences of returnees and the RU on people living in the IDP showed this as well. 

Abuse even from the protectors happen a lot once power imbalances exist. https://t.co/6BGpug0R3Q

author: Ngunan Ioron Aloho, esq, PMP
text:
I had an £18,700 fees to pay with scholarships or external support, and by His grace and work opportunities, I have paid £16,900. 

Now just left with £1100 to go. 

I looked back this week and I gave him all the praise. https://t.co/4Y2zHgGX2K

author: Ngunan Ioron Aloho, esq, PMP
text:
I love my course so much. This term was even better than the last and I got to write a policy brief. 

Looking forward to practicing this in real world.

author: Ngunan Ioron Aloho, esq, PMP
text:
I designed the posters,while @_GodswillOkwori helped me to design the drop back banner and husbandman made peppered chicken. 

We had Okpa, locust beans soup, pepper soup; this was the absolute best and I was glad everyone loved it and finished it. https://t.co/LglEgPAbFG

author: Ngunan Ioron Aloho, esq, PMP
text:
Designed and hosted the “Cultured You” event for postgraduate students in school this week. 

It was amazing - I made a lot of different African meals and other students also made meals to represent their diverse countries. https://t.co/ZIZFYQnJUI

author: Ngunan Ioron Aloho, esq, PMP
text:
We created an illustration book - Victims Twice Over to share the experiences of residents at the IDP camp. 

Visit our website to get access: https://t.co/Emlxk52gwi https://t.co/uGrKmbQLDm

author: Ngunan Ioron Aloho, esq, PMP
Ngunan Ioron Aloho, esq, PMP
text:
We are here now. 

18 months working on this project and now we are exhibiting co-created artworks created by the survivors of sexual exploitation in IDP camps - Benue, Nigeria. 

#ThroughHerEyes 
#ruinidpcamps https://t.co/BcyfM4xGiF
